input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Unobserved confounders has a direct effect on education level and salary. Proximity to a college has a direct effect on education level. Education level has a direct effect on salary. Unobserved confounders is unobserved. For people living far from a college, the probability of high salary is 41%. For people living close to a college, the probability of high salary is 59%. For people living far from a college, the probability of college degree or higher is 49%. For people living close to a college, the probability of college degree or higher is 9%. Will college degree or higher increase the chance of high salary?
